comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Lots of UK factories converted to munitions manufacture during WWI and hired women. They were called "munitionettes". See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Munitionettes Descriptions at, for example: www.iknow-scotland.co.uk/tourist_information/south_west/g... wiki.answers.com/Q/What_would_happen_in_munition_factorie... Photos at: www.scienceandsociety.co.uk/results.asp?txtkeys1=Munition...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
And over at the IWM uploads to Flickr Commons, Lottie Meade (one of over 200 women munitions workers in England to die from work-related illness during WWI):
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/imperialwarmuseum/6798303774/]
